title: Financials Down As Treasury Yields Hold Near Lows — Financials Roundup
text:
Shares of banks and other financial institutions fell as Treasury yields hovered near recent lows.

Whatever happens with trade negotiations, some strategists expect further central-bank rate cuts.

"We see easier financial conditions helping growth and earnings over 6-to-12 months," said strategists at money manager BlackRock's Investment Institute, in a note to clients.

HSBC Holdings is planning further job cuts to its 238,000 workforce as interim Chief Executive Noel Quinn looks to make his mark on the bank as he competes for the top job, The Wall Street Journal reported.

Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell, speaking at the premiere of a documentary about one of his predecessors, highlighted the importance of an independent central bank on Monday, in an oblique reference to the steady criticism of the Fed's monetary policy from President Donald Trump in recent weeks.
